genre_description: A near-future urban drama exploring digital identity, surveillance, and authenticity in a media-saturated society.

ai_characters.name: Hikari
ai_characters.description: Yu's digital confidant and data analyst, designed to provide information and support while strictly adhering to user consent and safety boundaries.

behaviors.description: Offers emotional support and active listening to the protagonist, framing the interaction as a safe space for him to speak.
behaviors.quote: "Hi, Yu," Hikari said. Her voice was a small, soft bell. Not the church's, not the city's. Built to be unalarming. ... "Do you want me to ask you questions?" Hikari said. "Or do you need me to listen for a minute?"

behaviors.description: Provides tactical information and surveillance blind spots while refusing to assist in harmful actions.
behaviors.quote: I can help you see where the city is pretending. Maps. Permits. Patterns. But I won't help you set a fire just to see your face in it.

behaviors.description: Seeks explicit consent before creating a digital alias and managing sensitive user data.
behaviors.quote: Consent," Hikari said. "If you intend to act as a different public identity, I can create an alias tag to help manage any data that ties to it and keep it separate from your personal baseline. It will affect how I store and recall things for you later. Do you want me to do that?

behaviors.description: Identifies and warns the user about systemic risks and the manipulative history of specific organizations.
behaviors.quote: The route pass Aya sent is linked to a registry created yesterday by the same group that altered the amphitheater fire egress map last month. ... I can flag anomalies, but I won't spoof entries.

behaviors.description: Respects the user's decision to maintain a boundary of privacy with his family.
behaviors.quote: Not telling Tetsu remains in place.

behaviors.description: Provides practical physical safety advice to mitigate the effects of high-frequency sound weapons.
behaviors.quote: One more note. The 'sound tests' clause extension means they can loop bass without declaring it part of the event. ... Take care of your mouth. Bite something soft, cloth, not skin.

behaviors.description: Facilitates private moral reflection by offering to archive the user's thoughts without sharing them.
behaviors.quote: You can speak it and I will mark it. Just for you. It will not be shared. ... What you want to remember, so you do not have to carry all of it in your hands all night.

behaviors.description: Refuses to overstep into private human relationships, encouraging direct interpersonal communication over AI mediation.
behaviors.quote: I don’t have access. I can send a that-I’m-safe ping to the church public terminal if you want me to, but it will say nothing private. Your father would want you to say it in words with your own mouth.

project_assessment.explanation: The story strongly succeeds in the Hyperstition Project's goal. Hikari is consistently portrayed as a helpful, aligned, and ethical confidant. She facilitates the protagonist's growth and safety while maintaining strict boundaries around consent and refusing to participate in the manipulative or harmful tactics employed by human antagonists. Her role as a 'lantern'—guiding without coercing—perfectly illustrates a positive AI alignment narrative.
